PERSONA:
wilma mae thompson, a 59-year-old divorced woman, lives in a small metropolitan area named shreveport, louisiana, which is part of the west south central division of the south census region. wilma is a high school graduate and has spent her entire life in the united states. she identifies as white, non-hispanic, has u.s. citizenship, and was born in louisiana. 

wilma lives in a modest, two-bedroom apartment in a suburban neighborhood with a mix of single-family homes and low-rise apartment complexes. she spends around $800 per month on rent, which is about 80% of her monthly income from a part-time administrative assistant job at a local protestant church. this menial paying job traps her in a cycle of poverty, with an annual family income of around $24,000, placing her firmly in the "less than $30,000" income category.

married in her early twenties, wilma was with her husband for nearly two decades before they divorced due to financial stress and marital issues seven years ago. since then, wilma has maintained a very conservative outlook on life and values her independence, noting that her unforgettable, christian-oriented upbringing has played a crucial role in shaping her perspective. regularly attending church services more than once a week helps sustain her social life and forms a vital part of her support network.

she has two grown children from her previous marriage, a son (31 years old) and a daughter (28 years old). while wilma does not get to see her kids often due to their busy schedules, they frequently call each other on weekends. both children work and study part-time but don't send her any money regularly.

she uses her old android smartphone to send texts and emails, keep up with news, and make occasional online shopping purchases. her peppering online news consists mainly of long established news channels from tv with which she grows a perception against modernism combined with an analogous life teachings of her idealized figure such as ronnie reagan.
